meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an epigone.
meanings.sent1: The epigonic painting resembled the famous artist's work.
meanings.sent2: Her epigonic style of writing was heavily influenced by the author she admired.
meanings.sent3: The epigonic sculpture looked like a copycat version of the original artwork.
meanings.sent4: His epigonic behavior mirrored that of his older sibling.
meanings.sent5: The epigonic design was a clear imitation of the original masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an epigone or epigones.
meanings.sent1: The epigonic characteristics of the new play were evident.
meanings.sent2: The epigonic nature of the film industry often leads to similar plotlines.
meanings.sent3: Her epigonic fashion sense made her look like a trend follower.
meanings.sent4: The epigonic trends in music were predictable and unoriginal.
meanings.sent5: The epigonic patterns in the artwork showed a lack of originality.

meanings.definition: A person who is an epigone.
meanings.sent1: She was considered an epigonic in the literary world.
meanings.sent2: The epigonic struggled to establish their own unique identity.
meanings.sent3: The epigonic was always in the shadow of the famous artist.
meanings.sent4: Becoming an epigonic was not his goal; he aimed for originality.
meanings.sent5: The young writer felt like an epigonic compared to the established authors.
